Title: Ta-Nehisi Coates has a question for Israelis: 'Can you ever truly...

Title: Thai worker killed in northern Israel; IDF: Possibly hit by unexp...
Description: Nisan Miram, a 42-year-old migrant worker from Thailand, was employed in an apple orchard. Another worker who was with him experienced anxiety. Since the onset of the war, 42 foreign workers from Thailand have been killed, the majority during the Hamas attack on October 7

Title: Netanyahu prioritizes petty vengeance against defense chief Galla...
Description: While Israeli Defense Minister Gallant earned the trust of the U.S., Netanyahu's ties with Biden sharply deteriorated. One year after Oct. 7, the PM still sees Gallant as an enemy over his support for a hostage release deal, opposition to the judicial coup – and growing popularity

Title: Netanyahu still uncertain on Iran response, as Israeli army pushe...
Description: Israel's PM is having a good run: Hezbollah is crippled, the U.S. supports ground offensives in Lebanon, Iran's attack didn't do any major damage and gives him license to strike back. Unfortunately, his focus is currently on catchy names for Israel's multi-front war

Title: I constantly wonder if Sasha is managing to hold on to hope in G...

Title: Investigation: Netanyahu's government not only permits Jewish ter...
Description: Settlers call it a revolution: More than 60 illegal farm outposts have sprung up in the West Bank during the past seven years, seizing vast tracts of Palestinian land. With cheap labor provided by 'at-risk' youths, this enterprise has also become a main fomenter of Jewish terror in the territories – and the state is generously footing the bill

Description: The three reservists served in the IDF's 460th Brigade and were killed Thursday by an explosive device

Title: NSO's cash-for-cyber deal pushed by Israeli official sparks crimi...
Description: Israel's Defense Ministry actively supported NSO's sale of spyware in exchange for millions in cash, flown to Israel by private jet, but Colombian authorities deny purchasing it. Colombia has severed diplomatic relations with Israel, which may complicate their ability to obtain legal assistance from Israel

Title: UN report accuses Israel, Hamas of war crimes and crimes against ...
Description: The inquiry said that 'Israel has perpetrated a concerted policy to destroy Gaza's healthcare system,' and that Hamas 'committed the war crimes of torture, inhuman or cruel treatment,' by taking Israeli and foreign hostages and holding them captive

Title: Please come save us': Recordings of kibbutz hostage standoff rev...
Description: On October 7, Hamas terrorists held 15 Israeli civilians hostage at a home in Kibbutz Be'eri, demanding safe passage to Gaza. Recordings of phone calls obtained by Haaretz reveal critical communication failures between the various Israeli security forces involved in the rescue efforts, contributing to the deaths of all but two hostages

Recordings of phone calls obtained by Haaretz reveal critical communication failures between the various Israeli security forces involved in the rescue efforts, contributing to the deaths of all but two hostages

Title: Arab Israeli educator released after arrest over video allegedly ...
Description: Intisar Hijazi was arrested after posting a video of herself dancing and smiling with the caption 'On This Day 7/10/2023.' Israel Police later released her under restrictive conditions but stated that the investigation is still ongoing

Description: Ronny Gazinate immigrated with his family from France to Israel, and is survived by his wife and three children. In the same incident in which Gazinate was killed, another reservist was seriously wounded

Title: How can I go back to routine when my son is in the tunnels of Ga...
Description: Israeli hostage Omer Wenkert was abducted from the Nova Festival on October 7. He was documented alive in a Hamas video, tied up in a pickup truck next to lifeless bodies. 'We then realized that Israel doesn't have him, and our crusade to get him back home began,' says his mother, Niva Wenkert

Title: Brown University votes against divestment proposal, angering pro-...

Title: Two Israeli police officers investigated for arrest of women call...
Description: Two senior Israeli officers are suspected of abusing their authority, fraud and breach of trust after ordering the arrests of women who handed out leaflets calling to release Israeli hostages in a synagogue attended by MK Yuli Edelstein. One is also suspected of obstruction of justice

Title: EU aviation agency cancels recommendation against flying to Israe...
Description: The European Union Aviation Safety Agency now recommends that airlines 'implement a stringent monitoring process and risk assessment for each flight when intending to operate within the airspace of Israel.' The new recommendations are valid until the end of October

Title: Top Court orders Tel Aviv to allow gender-segregated service for ...
Description: The judges criticized the Tel Aviv municipality for their decision of prohibiting segregated services, saying the city seeks to discriminate against orthodox worshipers, and ordered that they hold the prayer service with a gender partition

Title: German journalist arrested in Beirut after interview with Israeli...

He was released after efforts by the German embassy in Lebanon

Title: Revealed: The face of the biggest arthropod that ever lived
Description: Primordial Earth was graced by giant bugs but the identity of the biggest of them all – Arthropleura at 8 feet and counting – has been a mystery. Now one with a head has finally been found

Title: Israel at war, day 369: Two killed, several wounded as Hezbollah ...
Description: Two killed, several wounded, by Hezbollah rocket barrages on Israel's north ■ Seven wounded in stabbing attack in central Israel; Attacker, a resident of the Israeli-Arab town of Umm al-Fahm, arrested ■ Netanyahu spoke with Biden and VP Harris on Israel's planned retaliatory strike against Iran ■ Israel strikes Beirut's Dahiyeh ■ 130 IDF soldiers warn they won't serve unless gov't works to obtain a hostage/cease-fire deal ■ Syrian state media: Seven killed in Israeli strike on Damascus ■ Here's what you need to know 369 days into the war

Title: Israel central bank holds interest rates, but says wartime inflat...
Description: Israel's annual inflation rate rose to 3.6 percent in August, stemming largely from supply constraints related to the expanding war on multiple fronts. Some investors have begun to speculate that inflation will continue to rise and possibly push the central bank to raising rates again

Title: Far-right Israeli groups try to sway Supreme Court presidency by ...

Title: Seven wounded in stabbing rampage in central Israeli city of Hade...

Title: After October 7, just how far right will Israel go?
Description: October 7 should have handed Israel's wild-eyed right the perfect storm for success: wartime rallying and vengeful fury. So why don't the polls over the past year back that up?

Title: An iconic Jerusalem village, magnet for pilgrims, faces a towerin...
Description: Ein Karem, a unique pastoral village in the Israeli capital, draws tourists from all over the world. Now, it's in danger of losing its charm due to a planned real estate project. 'There is incredible greed here,' says a resident who is fighting the construction plan

Title: Trump attends two October 7 memorial events in NY and Miami, meet...

Title: For a mother, when her child is a hostage, he's a hostage. It do...
Description: For me, he is alive,' says Yael Adar, mother of hostage Tamir Adar, who the IDF announced was killed in captivity. 'Cognitively, I know he's not, but emotionally I allow myself the illusion that maybe there was a mistake, that maybe he will be found injured, that he'll return'

Title: West Bank's Palestinians fear Israeli army and settlers will stop...

Title: Netanyahu led Israel into the worst year and the worst war in its...

Title: I want other people, 30 years from now, to see what war can do t...
Description: Ahead of the first anniversary of October 7, I asked nine Haaretz journalists if they would talk to me about that day. It's not an easy read, but it gives a little hope that if we write about it, document it, record it, we can show future generations what humanity's worst impulses lead to

Title: Mother of only British hostage held in Gaza is still fighting to ...
Description: Emily Damari was kidnapped from Kfar Azza on October 7. Her mother, who spoke at a commemoration event in London on Sunday, is pleading with both the British public and the government to not leave 'one of their own' behind

Title: Families demand accountability, hostage release at Oct. 7 'counte...
Description: I believe that from the ruins and destruction, from the hell we went through, a new generation is rising,' said Jonatan Shamriz, whose brother was accidentally killed by IDF soldiers in Gaza. He spoke at the event held before the divisive national ceremony organized by Netanyahu ally, Minister Miri Regev

Title: October 7 should be a day of rage, not remembrance
Description: When every day feels like October 7, we should lay aside mourning to save those who will be lost tomorrow. We should rage against a government that has abandoned its citizens, waging wars with no end, unleashing catastrophe on Gazans, annexing the West Bank and turning Israel into a pariah state

Title: Israeli army reservist shown reading Talmud passage to cuffed Pal...

Description: The hacking included a display of anti-Iran and anti-Hezbollah caricatures on the channel's Telegram account. Since the start of the Gaza war, Israel and Iran have been engaged in cyberware, with Tehran behind hundreds of attacks on Israeli targets

Title: Unprepared for a Hamas onslaught, ignored by their commanders, Is...
Description: At the Nahal Oz army outpost, the operations room was unprotected at all. At Kerem Shalom and Yiftah, the unarmed spotters continued to work as bodies piled up. An independent panel has uncovered numerous failures by the IDF and the government – alongside the heroism and the comradeship of these largely unarmed women soldiers on the Gaza border

Title: Unprepared for a Hamas onslaught, Israel's women spotters kept on...
Description: At the Nahal Oz army outpost, the operations room wasn't protected at all. At Kerem Shalom and Yiftah, the spotters continued to work as bodies piled up. At Kissufim, the spotters were literally left out in the dark. An independent panel has uncovered numerous failures

Title: Gaza's humanitarian disaster could blow up in Israel's face
Description: The Israeli government appears indifferent to the damage to Gaza's infrastructure and reduced aid, but international pressure and potential sanctions may force it to respond and fund relief efforts

Title: Gaza's humanitarian disaster could blow up in Israel's face
Description: The Israeli government appears indifferent to the damage to Gaza's infrastructure and reduced aid, but international pressure and potential sanctions may force it to respond and fund relief efforts

Title: Gaza's humanitarian crisis threatens to backfire on Israel
Description: Faced with international pressure, including possible military sanctions, Israel will be forced to acknowledge that it must provide a long-term solution to address the lack of aid to Gaza and the severe damage to civilian infrastructure caused during the war. It will also have to assume most of the economic burden

Title: Almost half of Jewish Israelis, nearly all Arab citizens think th...
Description: A slim majority of Israelis believe the time has come to end the war in Gaza, according to a survey by the Israel Democracy Institute. Title: Almost half the Jews, nearly all Arabs think the Gaza war must st...

Title: In the year since October 7, Israel saw worst environmental damag...

Title: 340,000 dunams have been set afire, causing worst damage in 60 ye...
Description: Israel Nature and Parks Authority says 196,000 dunams of total are in the north, with the Nahal Yehudia sustaining the worst damage. However, the most harm is actually caused by constant army operations

Title: Israelis gather in Hostage Square on eve of Oct. 7 to share stori...
Description: Hundreds of people gathered in Hostage Square in Tel Aviv to begin commemorations marking one year since October 7. Families of hostages shared their stories of that day, and those of their loved ones

Title: He believed it was possible to live a life that isn't just a war...
Description: Sharone Lifschitz's mother Yocheved returned from Hamas captivity, while her 84-year-old father remains in Gaza. But she is equally committed to bringing other hostages back: 'My fight isn't only over my dad, but equally for Sasha and Arbel and Itzik and Ofer'

Title: Despite Israel's military superiority, force alone won't change t...

Title: Why the West still backs Israel despite a year of war with Hamas ...
Description: In the wake of October 7, few in Israel expected the 'window of legitimacy' to degrade Hamas would stay open for an entire year. Title: Two Israeli soldiers killed in drone strike from Iraq in northern...

Title: The hostage families and survivors are outcasts because we remin...
Description: Merav Svirsky, whose brother Itay was killed while in Hamas captivity, is fighting to bring him and other hostages home. Though she believes the government sees the hostages' families as a nuisance, she insists the they will not be cast out: 'This fight is about remaining moral and ethical'

Title: Netanyahu's sophisticated deception of the Israeli public

Title: The hostages are buried alive, and there's no solidarity. Mutual...
Description: A year after his son Tal Shoham was kidnapped to the Gaza Strip, Gilad Korngold is disappointed with the government – but also with the Israeli public. 'I wonder what kind of country we live in, when shortly before the anniversary of the kidnappings people will go on vacation and celebrate Rosh Hashanah,' he says. 'In my dreams, I would expect a revolt, but I know it won't happen'

'In my dreams, I would expect a revolt, but I know it won't happen'

Description: The attack on Hezbollah's pagers and walkie-talkies, attributed to Israel, may herald a new age in warfare, in which no device is safe

Title: All the honey in the world can't sweeten this Rosh Hashanah
Description: During last Rosh Hashanah, before October 7, Israelis expressed hopeful wishes for a better Jewish New Year ahead. In their worst nightmares, no one could have conceived of what the holiday would feel like the following year

Description: Justices rejected the state's argument that a soldier's lack of explicit consent for posthumous reproduction severs the parental link

Title: Seven killed in Jaffa shooting attack, 16 wounded
Description: Two assailants opened fire toward a light rail station on Jaffa's Jerusalem Boulevard, and were shot. Police and army forces ruled out further threats after searching the area. Six of those wounded are in serious condition

Title: Daughter of Israeli-American hostage Keith Siegel begs the public...
Description: Ilan Siegel initially believed her father would be freed soon after his abduction from Kibbutz Kfar Azza on October 7. Title: Newly sworn-in Gideon Sa'ar in Knesset: Nobody in opposition trie...
Description: In response to charges that he broke promises not to join Netanyahu, Sa'ar said that since October 7 he has decided to 'to set aside the wars between the Jews and focus on the war against our enemies.' In his speech to the Knesset, he accused opposition members who attacked his decision of 'smears, libels and lies' and of having no impact on the country since the war's start

Title: Banned Columbia student who said 'Zionists don't deserve to live'...
Description: A suspension letter from the university cited an incident in which the student organized a human chain to block Zionist students from accessing the campus lawn. According to him, he was denied due process and fair treatment, and was targeted because he is Black and pro-Palestinian

Title: Israel's Education Ministry advised schools to celebrate Nasralla...
Description: The Ministry's Religious Education Administration suggested that schools organize celebrations, such as dancing or distributing food, to mark the death of the Hezbollah leader in an Israeli airstrike. While some schools followed the recommendation, it drew criticism from certain officials

Title: Israel set to enter new phase of Lebanon fighting, meaning close ...
Description: Israel is preparing for a ground incursion into southern Lebanon, an operation that will initially focus on Hezbollah military infrastructure near the border

Title: For Netanyahu's government, the endgame of war is war
Description: Between us and Jordan lies the reality Israel fights to ignore: millions of Palestinians with nowhere to go, waiting – like many Israelis I know – to live in peace. Yet, Israel's refusal to recognize a Palestinian partner and pursue a solution persists, despite Arab neighbors willing to help it get there

Title: Israel at war, day 360: IDF says it killed leaders of Hamas, PFLP...
Description: Israel reportedly conducting raids in southern Lebanon, planning limited but imminent ground op ■ Lebanon's caretaker PM Najib Mikati says his government is ready to send Lebanese army to south to ensure it is demilitarized ■ Shin Bet says it thwarted attempts by Iran to assassinate senior Israeli officials inside Israel ■ Here's what you need to know 360 days into the war

Title: He already lost one brother in Gaza's tunnels, now he's fighting ...
Description: Sharon Sharabi, whose brother Yossi was killed in Hamas captivity and whose other brother Eli remains a hostage, recently accompanied Prime Minister Netanyahu to the UN. 'He shook my hand, and I said to him: 'Think of this hand as the hand of a hostage reaching out to you for an entire year from Hamas tunnels, saying: I trust you, save me.''

Title: Report: Israel tracked Nasrallah with unknown substance before de...
Description: Saudi news channel Al Hadath reported that an unidentified man traveling from Iran to Beirut met with Nasrallah with the express purpose of shaking his hand in order to transfer a trackable substance onto the leader's palm

Title: Israel's High Court upholds decision to hold security prisoner's ...
Description: The judges dismissed the petition of the family of Walid Daqqa, ruling that the state's decision to withhold his body for use in hostage negotiations with Hamas was reasonable. Daqqa, a Palestinian with Israeli citizenship, died of cancer this year while in prison after fully serving his for his role in the murder of an Israeli soldier in 1987

Title: The young asylum seekers wishing to join the Israeli army, in exc...
Description: They were born and raised in Israel, but have no legal status. The children of Eritrean asylum seekers want nothing more than to be drafted. Now, a controversial plan being advanced by the state may take them up on it

Title: Israel on high alert for Oct. 7 and holiday period; issues warnin...
Description: Israeli security forces are expected to be on high alert after IDF and Shin Bet raised the possibility that Hamas leaders could encourage Gazans to march en masse toward the border with Israel on the one-year anniversary of October 7

Title: Netanyahu's ex-rival gifts him an even stronger grip on power - u...
Description: Without having to sacrifice one seat in the Knesset, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is now getting four more right-wing votes. It's a total victory over Gideon Sa'ar, the politician who was once one of his greatest rivals but is now the last link in the government food chain
